sen.j: 奥州藤原氏（おうしゅうふじわらし）は前九年の役・後三年の役の後の寛治元年（1087年）から源頼朝に滅ぼされる文治5年（1189年）までの間、陸奥国（後の陸中国）平泉を中心に出羽国を含む東北地方一帯に勢力を張った一族である。
sen.e: The Oshu Fujiwara clan was a clan family whose power stretched over the entire Tohoku region, primarily within the Hiraizumi region of Mutsu Province (later, this was referred to as the Rikuchu Province) and included Dewa Province during this same period of time; commencing in the year 1087 following these two wars, the Zenkunen War (the Early Nine Years' War) and the Gosannen War (the Later Three Years' War), and continuing up to 1089, when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo destroyed the Oshu Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 奥州藤原氏の遠祖である藤原頼遠は諸系図によると「太郎太夫下総国住人」であったと記され、陸奥国（後の陸中国）に移住した経緯はよく分かっていない。
sen.e: According to several genealogies, the authors and editors of those documents recorded FUJIWARA no Yorito as a remote ancestor of the Oshu Fujiwara clan, listing him as "Taro-Dayu who is a resident of the Shimousa Province."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to some genealogies, FUJIWARA no Yorito, a remote ancestor of the Oshu Fujiwara clan, was "Taro (a word used to express the first, biggest or best things) Taihu (officers whose rank were Goi [Fifth Rank] or above), a resident of Shimousa Province," but it is not clear how and why he moved to Mutsu Province (later, Rikuchu Province).
sen.cmt: 内容から見て、「太夫」は「タイフ」として意味を「（律令制で）位が一位から五位の者」とすべきかと思いました。、また「太郎」は「太郎」は「最初のもの、最大のもの、最高のものをさす語」としました。また、原文に従い本文と次の文を一文にまとめました。セルはそのままなのでご対処お願いします。
sen.e: According to some genealogies, FUJIWARA no Yorito, a remote ancestor of the Oshu Fujiwara clan, was "Taro (a word used to express the first, biggest or best things) Taihu (officers whose rank were Goi [Fifth Rank] or above), a resident of Shimousa Province," but it is not clear how and why he moved to Mutsu Province (later, Rikuchu Province).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし父親の藤原正頼が従五位下であったことと比較し頼遠が無官であることから、平忠常の乱において平忠常側についた頼遠が罪を得て陸奥国に左遷され、多賀国府の官人となったものと推測されている。
sen.e: However, in comparison to Yorito and FUJIWARA no Masayori (his father), his father had the Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) official title, while Yorito had no official title.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, from the fact that Yorito bore no official title while his father, FUJIWARA no Masayori, was titled Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), it is inferred that Yorito was demoted to Mutsu Province by the Imperial Court for his having taken Tadatsune's side during the revolt of TAIRA no Tadatsune and became an official of Taga no Kou (the provincial office in Mutsu Province).
sen.cmt: 「多賀国府」の読み方が不明なので、確認してください（「タカノコウ」あるいは「タガノコウ」と読むとしているウェブサイトがありますが、どれほど信頼性の置けるものなのかは不明です）。また、流れの良い訳文にするため、原文に従い本文と次の文を一文にまとめました。
sen.e: However, from the fact that Yorito bore no official title while his father, FUJIWARA no Masayori, was titled Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), it is inferred that Yorito was demoted to Mutsu Province by the Imperial Court for his having taken Tadatsune's side during the revolt of TAIRA no Tadatsune and became an official of Taga no Kou (the provincial office in Mutsu Province).

sen.e: However, some historians and experts were opposed to this opinion; sons of Tadatsune had not been punished for their part in the revolt by Tadatsune, so it was unthinkable that Yorito would have a punishment by implication in the revolt of Tadatsune.

Yet, there is an opposing opinion to it, which claims that it is unthinkable that Yorito was punished for his implication in Tadatsune's revolt on the ground that even Tadatsune's sons were not punished on this occasion.

sen.e: In the generation following Yorito, FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo (Gon no daibu [provisional master] of Watari region), a son of Yorito, significantly expanded the clans power; such as the management of a Shoen (manor in medieval Japan) in the Watari region.

At the time of Yorito's son, FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo (Gon no daibu [a provisional master] of the Watari region), the clan managed a shoen (a manor in medieval Japan) in the Watari region, which is the implication of the expansion of the clan's power.

sen.j: また経清は陸奥奥六郡を牛耳る豪族・安倍頼時の娘を娶って縁戚関係を結び、安倍氏一門の南方の固めとなっていた。
sen.e: Additionally, Tsunekiyo (a son of Yorito) married a daughter of ABE no Yoritoki, the local ruling family that controlled Okuroku-gun (six counties in the middle of Mutsu Province) in Mutsu Province, so forming a relative alliance with the Abe clan.

sen.cmt: 表現を簡潔にし、本文と次の文を原文通り一文にまとめました。

sen.j: 長久元年（1040年）より国府の推挙により数ヵ年修理職として在京し、陸奥国・藤原登任の下向に同行し帰省したとの説もある。
sen.e: Since 1040, some historians and experts have supported the theory that it was a Kokufu (provincial office) who had recommended Tsunekiyo for the Shurishiki (a government officer whose responsible for the construction and repair of buildings in the Imperial Palace during the Heian period) position, so Tsunekiyo would have stayed in the capital of Kyoto for several years; and it was when FUJIWARA no Narito of Mutsu Province left the capital that Tsunekiyo would have accompanied him and returned to his hometown in the Mutsu Province.

There is a theory which says that he had worked as shurishiki (a government officer responsible for the construction and repair of buildings in the Imperial Palace) in Kyoto for several years since 1040 on the recommendation of kokufu (a provincial office) and that he returned to his hometown accompanying Mutsu no Kami (the governor of Mutsu Province), FUJIWARA no Narito.
sen.cmt: 文法の誤りを直しました。原文が「陸奥国・藤原登任」となっていますが、Wikipediaの文中では「陸奥守・藤原登任」となっています。文章の流れからしてもこちらの方が適当かと思います。ここでは「陸奥守・藤原登任」として訳しておきます。

sen.j: しかし、近年の研究では藤原経清について永承2年（1047年）の五位以上の藤原氏交名を記した「造興福寺記」に名前が見えている。
sen.e: However, more recent research of historian and experts have identified FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo in a book, the "Zokofuku-ji-ki" (the chronicle of the Zokofuku-ji Temple) in 1047; in this book, the author and editor collected and entered the names of the Fujiwara clan who had attained a level higher than the goi (Fifth Rank) Imperial official title.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, a recent study has identified the name "FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo" on the list of the names of the Fujiwara clan members whose official ranks were Goi (Fifth Rank) or above, written in 'Zo Kofuku-ji ki' (the document about the reconstruction of Kofuku-ji Temple) made in 1047.
sen.cmt: 「造興福寺記」は「興福寺の再建記録」で、「造興福寺」という寺はないと思います。他、過剰な訳出部を除き、文法の誤りを直しました。
